title: Six Months In: Thoughts On The Current Post-Twitter Diaspora Options

last_post.content: It's been six months since Elon took over Twitter. I have some thoughts on the "Twitter diaspora" and the current decentralized alternatives: https://www.techdirt.com/2023/04/28/six-months-in-thoughts-on-the-current-post-twitter-diaspora-options/

✨ Grifter-free Fediverse Discovery

We built an opt-in directory of people using bio hashtags as topics.

https://fediverse.info/explore/people

One more thing, we're building an API to power discovery and follow recommendations in our project and the API will be open and available to anyone, including other fediverse projects! #fediverseInfo

I have a new game! And it is out now:

Drift Mine Satellite is a maintenance text adventure about a person living underground in a limestone mine, and their work on the local communication network that has sprung up there.

It is a utopian apocalypse fantasy, a forever-camping world narrowed to linear miles of RVs parked under a mountain, the people who live in them, and the systems that interconnect them, both social and material.

Find Drift Mine Satellite here; http://solarprotocol.net/sunthinking/#pipkin

🛰️

This webstore has a great Stock of ”Sorry, as an AI” products.

https://www.proshop.fi/?s=sorry+as+an+AI

Looks like @arstechnica is now verified on here! Always great to see this feature used. It'll be even more prominent in the future.

https://joinmastodon.org/verification
NOTHING GOOD OUT THEIR ANY WAY - http://DASHARE.ZONE ADMIN

I came across a neat browser extension today. It looks for "rel=me" links pointing to mastodon profiles, and puts it in a little list for you to review.

In other words, you visit a website, and if tells you if there are any mastodon accounts associated to the website.

http://streetpass.social

Oh nice. Seattle Public Library has created a membership type for "13 to 26 year olds anywhere in the US" to be able to sign out e and audiobooks as a response to those locales banning books...

https://www.spl.org/programs-and-services/teens/books-unbanned

"Read the books they don't want you to. That's where the good stuff is." - LeVar Burton

30 years ago, one decision altered the course of our connected world

On April 30, 1993, the World Wide Web was released into the public domain. It revolutionized the internet and allowed users to create websites filled with graphics, audio and hyperlinks.

🔗 https://www.npr.org/2023/04/30/1172276538/world-wide-web-internet-anniversary

#technology #npr #news #press #media #independent #usa

I'm the admin there too. I have help with mod stuff, @jacobschumer is probably busy with Jedi Survivor at the moment but he’ll emerge at some point and be there to shoot down trolls and such as well.

🔔 #News zum Call for Papers der @FORGE23 🔔
Die Frist für Beitragseinreichungen wurde bis zum 15.05.2023 verlängert!

Die FORGE – Forschungsdaten in den Geisteswissenschaften, findet unter dem Motto "Anything Goes?!" vom 4. bis 6. Oktober 2023 in Tübingen statt.
Es sind drei Arten von Konferenzbeiträgen möglich: #Workshops, #Vorträge und #Poster
Weitere Infos zur #FORGE23 und dem #CfP gibt es unter: https://forge23.uni-tuebingen.de/

#Forschungsdaten #DigitalHumanities

Can we make the fediverse the welcoming-est place in social media?

We’re a soft-launching a new welcoming committee. All you have to do is reply to introduction posts to say hello and offer help.

We hope you’ll follow @welcoming and mention to the group how many people you welcomed, so we all know that we’re working as a team.

You can point people to https://SpreadMastodon.org, https://discover.fedified.com, or any other resources you like!

@spreadmastodon@venera.social

speaking from my corner of academia, it's almost unfathomable to me how swiftly the advances in accessibility forced by the pandemic have been rolled back. they're just... gone, often eliminated not by administration but by well-intentioned and supposedly progressive colleagues who refuse to accommodate for remote presence. it's bizarre.

https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbeseq/2023/04/28/why-remote-access-is-the-new-curb-cut-for-modern-accessibility

If you want to onboard friends and family to the Fediverse, https://jointhefediverse.net is an amazing tool.

Made by @stefan, this site explains -- in easy-to-understand words -- what the Fediverse is, how it works, and what to try.

This is a must for everyone who wants to tell the world about the Fediverse!

@fediversenews

People are calling today the 30th birthday of the web; more accurately it’s the 30th birthday of CERN releasing the source code. I vividly remember websites being a curiosity among FTP servers, Usenet newsgroups, and gopher holes.

Here’s to this marvelous technology, Earth’s biggest Choose Your Own Adventure book, one of the most backwardly compatible systems ever built. Modern browsers may be elaborate interpreter-compilers but they still render the first site: http://info.cern.ch/hypertext/WWW/TheProject.html

:meowybara: Take a breath and settle in: https://mastodon.art/@Curator/10820579

title: Wiley Removes Goodin as Editor of the Journal of Political Philosophy | Daily Nous

last_post.content:
I posted on the other site that to protect academic freedom and save money, universities need to invest in scholar-led publication initiatives that bypass the for-profit publishers.

Part of this is recognizing that #OA is entirely compatible with for-profit model that sucks resources out of unis while reducing average quality of work.

See this link for an example from philosophy, where Wiley is pushing editors to increase number of papers by factor of 10 to start.

https://dailynous.com/2023/04/27/wiley-removes-goodin-as-editor-of-the-journal-of-political-philosophy/

Here's my prediction.

With ActivityPub, Mastodon will soon find a challenger that starts getting more attention.

Maybe is will be the *key apps. Maybe it will be Barcelona. Maybe it will be WordPress.

But when this starts happening, this will shake up the community-at-large -- and completely change the direction of the protocol.

https://indieweb.social/@tchambers/110284145745758193

@fediversenews

title: ChatGPT and other AI Tech Relies on Your Contributions

last_post.content:
I'm glad to see reporting looking into the data theft behind "AI". But it's super frustrating to be misquoted like this. I was not talking about "current laws", nor about "AIs". Collections of linear algebra are not the kind of things that can have accountability, period.

I've sent email to @mimsical asking for a correction, but haven't heard back. (It is a Saturday, but also the piece went live today.) Hopefully he can get the WSJ to correct the article.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/chatgpt-ai-artificial-intelligence-openai-personal-writing-5328339a

title: Algorithmen & Zeichen. Beiträge von Frieder Nake zur Gegenwart des Computers

last_post.content:
The book »Algorithmen & Zeichen« with essays from Frieder Nake is now available as open access! The book was edited by Jan Distelmeyer, Sophie Ehrmanntraut and myself. It contains 18 texts (15 on German, 3 on English) from Frieder Nake — as well as an excerpt of his artistic work.

If you are into media theory, computer science, computer art and / or UX design: this book might be something for you!

https://www.mediarep.org/handle/doc/20565

Missed the exciting news that the boffins at NASA JPL have figured out a way to use reserve power to keep using all the scientific instruments on board Voyager 2 for even longer. For a mission that only had a requirement to last until about 1982, job well done. https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasas-voyager-will-do-more-science-with-new-power-strategy

Several years ago, I wrote extensively about space probes, including *six* articles about or involving the Voyager probes! https://glog.glennf.com/blog/2017/8/4/if-you-love-voyager-like-i-love-voyager

Good morning! The weather is looking fine today. Yesterday turned out a bit too windy for my liking.

I enjoy taking potshots at BlueSky. First, it's easy. Second, in difference to ActivityPub, I'm not invested enough, to feel any desire to fix it. So call me posting about BlueSky a form of deflection.

Anyway, today's look at the AT Protocol: How can I extend it? The answer is surprisingly simple; They reinvented the wheel. Let's hope they find enough volunteers to build the tooling they want to offer good developer experience.

For example, json-ld DX is not great, but it exists. Also these people have been at it for at least 12 years, if my date lookup works. Their mailing list speaks of meetings once a month. So yes not great, but inspiring.

title: This Bird Photo May Break Your Brain (And No, It Wasn't Photoshopped)

last_post.content:
Ceci n'est pas un photomontage. C'est fou non ?
En réalité, vous voyez :
- en haut à droite, un mur orangé
- en bas à droite, le reflet du mur
- et la partie de gauche est l'eau sans réflexion à part le ciel

C'est absolument magnifique.

Voir ici: https://petapixel.com/2023/04/17/this-bird-photo-may-break-your-brain-and-no-it-wasnt-photoshopped/

#photo

title: Recent, rapid ocean warming ahead of El Niño alarms scientists

last_post.content:
Let’s not forget that, while a mainstay of climate disaster movies, the “plucky scientist that yells at the politicians” character is also a fiction.

From the article:

Several scientists contacted for this story were reluctant to go on the record about the implications.

One spoke of being "extremely worried and completely stressed."

title: Woman with Cancerous Pregnancy Was Told to Wait in Parking Lot Until She Was 'Crashing'

last_post.content:
So barbaric: Woman with Cancerous Pregnancy Was Told to Wait in Parking Lot Until She Was 'Crashing'”

"We can't touch you unless you're crashing in front of us or your blood pressure goes so high that you're fixing to have a heart attack," she says she was told.

https://jezebel.com/woman-with-cancerous-pregnancy-was-told-to-wait-in-park-1850375358
The latest ContraPoints is as good as any of them. Please watch it, even if you can only do a chapter at a time. https://youtu.be/EmT0i0xG6zg

@healthstatsdude @ct_bergstrom @knewman
I'll give a shameless plus for #ggdist, which makes it easy to create a bunch of visualizations of distributions, including density plots, dotplots, and beeswarms: https://mjskay.github.io/ggdist/

One big difference compared to ggbeeswarm is that ggdist will automatically set the dot size to ensure the chart does not overrun the display area

After weeks of care-full work from the brilliant program committee, #ACH2023 acceptances are out! I'm sending gratitude to the committee (Caitlin Pollock, @apjanco, @alexwermercolan, Eduard Arriaga, Sarah Potvin). And 💫especially💫 to
@pam, our amazing, compassionate Chair. Collaborating with Pam on #ACH2023 has been the best part of my academic year.

I cannot wait for y'all to see the program (soon soon!). This year's @ach conference is going to be something special. And, registration is open! Join us this summer!

title: Large Language Models are Versatile Decomposers: Decompose Evidence and Questions for Table-based Reasoning

last_post.content:
Large Language Models are Versatile Decomposers for Table-based Reasoning

Surpasses the human performance on Tabfact for the first time by decomposing a large table and leveraging SQL execution to mitigate the hallucination of CoT.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13808

title: CDC meeting, intended to mark covid progress, sees virus cases of its own

last_post.content:
The CDC is saying their superspreading event is no big deal because #COVID is everywhere.

Yet they also canceled trainings, paid for isolation, staff have access to tests, treatment etc.

COVID may seem like no big deal if you have resources, but this isn’t the case for many.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2023/04/28/covid-cases-cdc-conference/

title: Red Hat layoffs spark calls to unionize, CEO wades in

last_post.content:
Red Hat's decision to lay off 800 employees, despite being a profitable company, is disheartening. With executives not taking pay cuts, the burden of this decision is not shared equally. I stand in solidarity with the affected workers and encourage us to challenge the capitalist logic that prioritizes profits over people. Let's support each other and build a more equitable future. #RedHat #Layoffs #Solidarity #WorkersRights

https://www.theregister.com/2023/04/28/red_hat_layoffs_union/

title: Join the Nora Roberts Challenge to Help Fight Against Book Bans!

last_post.content:
Join the Nora Roberts Challenge to Help Fight Against Book Bans! - EveryLibrary Institute

"The same week that we announced that Nora Roberts made a donation to EveryLibrary Institute, her books were banned in schools in Florida!

Now she's challenging you to join her by participating in the #NoraRobertsChallenge by making a tax-deductible donation to fight against book bans and challenging your friends to do the same" https://www.everylibraryinstitute.org/norarobertschallenge

I’m delighted to discover that Eyes of the Void and Ogres have made the Locus award shortlists in their respective categories, in some truly excellent company https://locusmag.com/2023/04/2023-locus-awards-top-ten-finalists-2/

title: People Can't Believe This Photo of a Bird Isn't Photoshopped or AI-Generated

last_post.content:
New dress controversy. Is the water blue or gold?

Not photoshop. Not AI.

https://mymodernmet.com/kenichi-ohno-bird-photo-illusion/

"So what is happening behind the egret that is causing the illusion? In the upper right-hand corner, there is a cream-colored wall. What we see below the wall is its reflection in the water and the position of the photographer has allowed for a perfectly straight “cut” in the composition, so one side is all water and the other side is the wall and its reflection."

Photo by Kenichi Ohno

title: King Charles coronation: Does Scotland want its kilted king?

last_post.content: On the #BBC: Does #Scotland want its kilted #king. Mmm. As a Scot there are few things that wind me up about the #RoyalFamily as much as Prince Charles or rather #KingCharles as he is now insisting on wearing a #kilt so much in Scotland. It isn't how Scottish people #dress everyday. It isn't something we can relate to or recognise in our experiences. It's playing at #nationality, playing at #culture, playing at dress up. And it's woefully inappropriate and ill judged. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-65424929

title: Bridge to Obscurity by Bill Gallagher

last_post.content:
Bridge to Obscurity

This image was captured on a July afternoon when the marine layer inverted and pulled a big fog bank into the San Francisco Bay over the Golden Gate bridge.
The fog seems to swallow the bridge almost completely. Here you see the bridge as it disappears slowly into the fog looking as if it just ends in the middle of nowhere. See the Full image here: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/bridge-to-obscurity-bill-gallagher.html #BridgeToObscurity #BillGallagherPhotography #AYearForArt #GoldenGateBridge #Fog #Foggy #SanFrancisco

These kinds of projects give me the old-internet feels. A great idea, executed well, and filling an important niche. Rate your landlords, folks!

https://ratethelandlord.org

Over on Bluesky @xor pointed out this interesting analysis of AT Protocol (not all positive) from back in November... from someone who now (well after writing that) works for Bluesky. It's worth reading if you're trying to understand the differences between ActivityPub and AT Protocol. https://bnewbold.net/2022/atproto_thoughts/

title: Computer Shopper February 1986 : Computer Shopper : Free Download, Borrow, and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content:
I'm happy to announce the first of the Computer Shoppers has been scanned.

https://archive.org/details/computer-shopper-february-1986

This includes an Aesthetic and Readable version (aimed towards looking like the bleedthrough newsprint original, as well as one for better reading). Thanks to Gaming Alexandria for post-processing. The 70gb RAW scans will also be made available.

Tons of points were learned doing this, so expect the next ones to rock harder. Thanks, everyone who contributed to this project.

title: SFWA’s Inaugural Infinity Award Honoree Is Octavia E. Butler

last_post.content:
SFWA has created a new award: the Infinity Award. SFWA’s Grand Master Award can only be given to a living person, so the Infinity is the corresponding award for people who’ve died.

The first Infinity Award recipient is Octavia E. Butler.

https://file770.com/sfwas-inaugural-infinity-award-honoree-is-octavia-e-butler/

Mastodon's official numbers have it growing around 200 accounts per hour, not the ~1300 shown lately by a bot we all enjoy.

So in April Mastodon added 40k MAU and 141k accounts.

Thank you to @tobiaalberti for keeping historical data on Mastodon's official statistics, at https://cryptpad.fr/sheet/#/2/sheet/view/8TmIxgfFMBQ9h4maRV79wdiEwlu-37v3gRfTKUFDwEM/

Thanks also to @hildabast for citing that data, and @laurenshof for citing Hilda's recent essay!

title: The 19th Century Woman Who Predicted Global Warming

last_post.content:
An appreciation of Eunice Foote, the suffragist and scientist who — way back in 1856 — conducted the first known experiment to demonstrate that CO2 was a heat-trapping gas …

…. and who, when writing up a paper of her findings, theorized that if the Earth’s atmosphere accumulated lots of CO2, the planet would warm up also

Alas, her work was lost to history until quite recently: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-19th-century-woman-who-predicted-global-warming-af93f6b473ce

A “friend” link in case you’re not a Medium subscriber: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-19th-century-woman-who-predicted-global-warming-af93f6b473ce?sk=2132215cf9d7a17c2f7d1e43d0ffd7af

title: Keep Your Memories, Kill Your Nostalgia

last_post.content:
"I have killed my affection for Harry Potter. I have buried it. I am refusing to allow this series space in my life. Trans people are worth more than Rowling is. They are worth more than Rowling’s world. They are worth opening and suturing a wound, and moving past a children’s story. Real people are harmed by Rowling’s rhetoric, and giving her stories more space in our cultural consciousness is harmful to one of the most marginalized groups of people in the world."

https://gizmodo.com/harry-potter-rowling-terf-tv-series-hbo-max-nostalgia-1850363444

30 years ago, one decision altered the course of our connected world

On April 30, 1993, the World Wide Web was released into the public domain. It revolutionized the internet and allowed users to create websites filled with graphics, audio and hyperlinks. #press

https://www.npr.org/2023/04/30/1172276538/world-wide-web-internet-anniversary?utm_medium=JSONFeed&utm_campaign=news&utm_source=press.coop

Weak Institutions: It's not a fair fight

OMG I *just* found out that VICTORIES GREATER THAN DEATH is one of five books being included in the @ALALibrary's new Imagining Tomorrow program about "inclusive futures." This is so amazing and I feel so freaking lucky. 🤩😍🤩

This is a discussion group for local teens all over the USA.

title: Takoma Park Man Arrested for Possession of Child Pornography

last_post.content:
Introducing you to Takoma Park, MD elementary school librarian Charles Sutherland, who took it upon himself to spray-paint GROOMER on two public libraries during Pride week - likely because the libraries held Pride events.

What did police find when they searched the home of Sutherland - a single man with no children, nieces, or nephews?
-diapers
-children's dolls
-a child-sized, life-like doll, in Sutherland's bed
-child porn on his laptop
News report:
https://www.sourceofthespring.com/takoma-park-news/2804290/takoma-park-man-arrested-for-possession-of-child-pornography/

Sutherland is number 113 on our list of bigots, fascists, and far-right extremists who are also child sex predators:
https://antifainternational.tumblr.com/post/170045856829/our-updated-list-of-racists-bigots-far-right

When far-right extremists scream about groomers, it's #projection

title: Senate GOP blocks Equal Rights Amendment

last_post.content:
It's telling that this was nowhere near front page news.

"Senate Republicans on Thursday blocked a measure that would have allowed the Equal Rights Amendment (ERA) to be added to the Constitution.

Senators voted 51 to 47 to invoke cloture on a motion to proceed, falling short of the 60 votes needed.
Sens. Lisa Murkowski (Alaska) and Susan Collins (Maine) were the lone Republicans to vote with every Democrat. “

#lawfedi

Senate GOP Blocks Equal Rights Amendment | https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/3975654-senate-gop-blocks-equal-rights-amendment/
